questions.text: Primigravida came to emergency depertment at 1 pm with 5cm dilatation with membrane present and good uterine contractions, when PV repeated at 4pm she is 6 cm dilated +2, what is the next step to do?

questions.text: What is the correct sequence of lactation:
A 20 weeks pregnant female has low lying placenta covering partially the os what will be your next appropriate management?

options.label: A
options.text: Do USG again at 32 and look for the placenta location

options.label: C
options.text: Do USG at 38 weeks and if possible do normal vaginal delivery

options.label: D
options.text: Do USG at 39 weeks and if still persists do elective CS

questions.correct_answer: A. Do USG again at 32 and look for the placenta location

questions.text: A 38 weeks GA female after delivering the baby becomes hypotensive and becomes unresponsive on evluation the fundus of the uterus is extending outside the vaginal opening, in this stage along with the placentia still attached what is the next step in management ?

options.label: C
options.text: Manual reposition of the uterus in anatomical position

questions.correct_answer: C. Manual reposition of the uterus in anatomical position
